intro: Dermatophyllum purpusii, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in the spring and summer. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping it conserve water in its harsh environment. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its role in supporting local wildlife.
